definition: to swagger off/to walk off (or drive off etc) without a second thought for those left behind
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate
variant of 揚|扬[yang2]
length/long/forever/always/constantly
chief/head/elder/to grow/to develop/to increase/to enhance
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: Then, several motorcycle march off, leaving the engine sound.
sentences.chinese: 接着，几台摩托车扬长而去，留下阵阵的引擎声。

sentences.english: Ignoring a homeless person who asks for money.
sentences.chinese: 街上一个无家可归的人向你要钱，你扬长而去。

sentences.english: After Plagiarist snatched Genuine's Intellectual Property Rights, he walk away quickly.
sentences.chinese: 剽窃者抢夺正版的智慧财产权后，快步扬长而去。

sentences.english: The professor have a look at the flabbergasted student, then swaggered off.
sentences.chinese: 教授看了看那个目瞪口呆的学生，扬长而去。

sentences.english: To his surprise, when these people saw him, they stalked off laughing.
sentences.chinese: 不料想，那几个人看见他，一阵大笑之后扬长而去。

sentences.english: Professor looked at the flabbergasted student and proceeded on his way.
sentences.chinese: 看了看那位目瞪口呆的学生，教授扬长而去。

sentences.english: One employee threw a cup of coffee and walked out.
sentences.chinese: 有个人把一杯咖啡摔在地上后就扬长而去。

sentences.english: And I watch my words from a long way off.
sentences.chinese: 然后我就这样看你开着我的船扬长而去？

sentences.english: The Forty Thieves stole everything and rode away.
sentences.chinese: 四十盗贼偷完东西扬长而去。

definition: like a wisp of smoke/(to disappear etc) in an instant
dull gray/gloomy/dejected/crestfallen/with one's tail between one's legs
to turn on one's heels/to walk away abruptly
directly
to throw down/to drop (bomb)
to leave/to walk away/to beat it/to move aside
to abandon
to strut/swaggering
to storm off in a huff (idiom)
to rush out through a door (idiom)
furious/enraged
without leave/without consulting anyone
to not say a word (idiom)
to escape without trace (idiom); to make one's getaway (from the scene of a crime)/to show a clean pair of heels
at a stride/taking large steps (while walking)
to not say a word
